720780f-a.text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street), south from but not including Bleecker Street, showing construction work in progress on the Interborough Rapid Transit Co. (I.R.T.) subway, after the demolition of houses which formerly stood there. Lafayette Street was created as a result of the joining together of Lafayette Place, which terminated at Great Jones Street, with Elm Street, which commenced at a point slightly south of Jersey Street. This necessitated the razing of many buildings which occupied the area between the above mentioned two streets. The new thoroughfare was given its present name several years later.
December 1900.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
William B. Parsons Collection.
720780f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Bleecker Street, Manhattan, NY

720806f-a.text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street) north from Bleecker, to and including East 8th Street (where it terminates), showing the street under construction after the demolition of buildings which formerly stood there. The construction of the street necessitated the razing of many buildings in a northerly direction from Elm Street which terminated slightly south of Jersey Street, to Lafayette Place which commenced at Great Jones Street. The new street was named Lafayette Street several years later.
July 17, 1900.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
William B. Parsons Collection.
NEG # 3804
720806f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Bleecker Street, Manhattan, NY

720804f-a.text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street), north from but not including Bleecker, to and including East 8th Streets (where it terminates), showing the street under construction. The building of the street necessitated the razing of many houses in a northerly direction from Eln Street, which terminated at a point slightly south of Jersey Street, to Lafayette Place, which commenced at Great Jones Street. The new thoroughfare was named Lafayette Street several years later, and under it was constructed the Interborough Rapid Transit Co. (I.R.T.) subway.
April 1, 1901.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
william B. Parsons Collection.
720804f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Bleecker Street, Manhattan, NY

720779f-a.text:
336 Lafayette Street, west side, north from Bleecker Street, to and including Shinbone Alley. Also shown (left) are Nos. 59 to 69 Bleecker Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Lafayette Street.
March 19, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.
